arch:property.oc:show_val: Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The remainder of the subterranean canalization is installed including the East Plaza Great Cistern. The East and South Perimeter Walls are installed and Rooms A and B and the Tabun Cave Room are built into the casemate of the East Perimeter Wall. The East Plaza and South Passageway are paved and the temple Forecourt is raised and laid with a small hexagonal pavement. Residential Quarter is built in the southwest corner of the precinct. Also at this time the Central Staircase of Phase II is blocked and the lateral East and West Staircases are constructed to access the Lower Temenos.
The south boundary of Trench 83 extending the entire length and bonding with the façade wall excavated in Trench 77 in the 2000 field season in front of the east bedrock escarpments.
Locus 17 west bedrock escarpments; Locus 30 south pavement.
Locus 13 south terracing; Locus 38 north/south threshold to Anteroom.

Locus 13 south terracing; Locus 14 east wall of Anteroom; Locus 15 south wall of Anteroom; Locus 20 door jamb; Locus 38 outer threshold between Anteroom and south passageway; Locus 35 inner threshold between Anteroom and Chapel; Locus 17 west bedrock escarpment; Locus 33 dividing wall between Chapel and Anteroom; Locus 19 east wall of Chapel; Locus 16 south wall of Chapel; Locus 21 east niche blocks; Locus 22 west niche blocks; Locus 28 bottom platform of niche; and Locus 37 north wall of Chapel.

The south retaining wall of the passageway is in poor condition, only small sections of the original façade wall remain intact usually only two or three courses in height. In the east central section of the trench, six courses remain intact but dramatically slump forward in a northwesterly direction at a precipitous angle of approximately 30 degrees. This remaining section of the façade wall shows the violent force and pressure of the weight of the terraces behind. In antiquity, this wall would have extended at least to the height of the surrounding bedrock escarpments, forming a dramatic south architectural boundary for the Upper Temenos. The continuation of this wall in the west provided the north walls for the Anteroom and the Chapel. In the west, the wall was entirely robbed out near the Chapel and Anteroom except for its foundation course which remains intact. It is likely, as the rooms fell out of use and the western portion of the wall, which did not provide either structural or aesthetic protection from the terraces was robbed out first.
Closing elevation: -2.77 m or 905.523 m at Sub datum E, -1.37 m or 905.597 m at Sub datum G.

Construction of walls including the South Perimeter Wall and associated elements and pavement. In this phase, the Anteroom, Shrine Room and other rooms behind the South Perimeter Wall are constructed and furnished.
24.90 m in length east to west-by-2.77 m high in one area but the average height is 1.37 m.
Opening elevation: 0.00 m or 908.293 m at Sub datum E, 0.00 m or 906.967 m at Sub datum G.
